questions.text: My access to quality nutrition is ...

answers.4: reliable — I have consistent access to good food
answers.5: excellent — quality nutrition is built into my life
answers.3: moderate — decent most of the time

questions.text: My sleep giving me energy reserves (not just enough to get by) is ...

answers.4: usually — I have energy most days
answers.5: consistent — I wake with reserves to deploy
answers.3: inconsistent — some weeks good, others exhausted

questions.text: My living environment as a resource (not a liability) is ...
questions.principle: Environment can add or subtract energy

answers.5: excellent — my space actively contributes to my wellbeing
answers.2: neutral at best — it doesn't help
answers.3: mixed — some aspects support me, others don't
answers.1: draining — my space works against me

questions.text: Financial margin for quality food, rest, and environment is ...

answers.4: comfortable — I can afford what I need
answers.3: moderate — enough for basics, little extra

questions.text: Physical recovery exceeding expenditure (building reserves) is ...

answers.5: consistent — I'm clearly accumulating physical capital
answers.2: barely breaking even — surviving but not building
answers.1: not happening — I'm depleting faster than recovering

remediation.advice: Physical provision surplus requires both skill (knowing what your body needs) and financial/time resources to provide it. If you're constantly running a deficit, identify whether it's knowledge, money, time, or priority that's the bottleneck.

scripture.text: It is in vain that you rise up early and go late to rest, eating the bread of anxious toil; for he gives to his beloved sleep.
